annotations.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat
annotations.html_description: Unique message identifier inside this chat
annotations.rst_description: Unique message identifier inside this chat
annotations.name: message_id

annotations.description: Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only
annotations.html_description: Optional. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only
annotations.name: message_thread_id

annotations.description: Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
annotations.name: from

annotations.description: Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field *from* contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
annotations.name: sender_chat

annotations.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time
annotations.html_description: Date the message was sent in Unix time
annotations.rst_description: Date the message was sent in Unix time
annotations.name: date

annotations.description: Conversation the message belongs to
annotations.html_description: Conversation the message belongs to
annotations.rst_description: Conversation the message belongs to

annotations.description: Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.
annotations.name: supergroup_chat_created

annotations.description: Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.
annotations.name: channel_chat_created

annotations.description: The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
annotations.html_description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
annotations.name: migrate_to_chat_id

annotations.description: The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
annotations.html_description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
annotations.name: migrate_from_chat_id
